channel.title: Aviation on Martin's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Aviation on Martin's Blog

item.title: Ooops, or how I ripped my container on a Cessna 206, part 1
item.description: My recent visit to the motherland gave me the opportunity for yet another skydiving session, I joined my instructor and mentor Ale≈° Debeljak from the Paranoia skydiving school. All went well and on the third jump of the second day just as I exited the Cessna 206 I apparently managed to hook my rig on the side of the door which resulted in a nasty tear in my container on the reserve parachute flap.

item.title: Skydive London for a day
item.description: Last weekend I did what I wanted to do for a long while - to actually skydive in the UK. I’ve been putting it off for a long time, lately mostly due to the weather we have been having. Last weekend the weather was OK, no flu lingering in the background and no lameness in any of the legs :-) The Skydive London dropzone is situated about 3 hours drive away from Haverfordwest , adjacent to the town of Swindon .
